timing_log_check.pl

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/usr/bin/perl
00002 
00003 # This script reads the timing log and outputs timing information including
00004 # the number and per cent of accesses taking various amount of time.
00005 # It can give you a rough idea of how well your server id performing.
00006 # If you have a large timing log, it can tale awhile for the script to complete processing.
00007 
00008 # To run the script, cd to the WeBWorK logs directory (usually /opt/webwork/webwork2/logs)
00009 # and enter the command: timing_log_check.pl 
00010 
00011 # Note that this assumes perl is locates in /usr/bin/perl (check with the command "which perl")
00012 # and /opt/webwork/webwork2/bin/ is in your path.
00013 
00014   open(PGFILE,'timing.log') || warn "Can't read timing.log: $!";
00015   my @lines = <PGFILE>; close(PGFILE);
00016 
00017   my $under0point1sec = 0;
00018   my $under0point2sec = 0;
00019   my $under0point5sec = 0;
00020   my $under1sec = 0;
00021   my $under2sec = 0;
00022   my $under3sec = 0;
00023   my $under4sec = 0;  
00024   my $under5sec = 0;
00025   my $under10sec = 0;
00026   my $over10sec = 0;
00027   my $nonvalid = 0;
00028   my $line;
00029   my $count = 0;
00030   my $time = 0;
00031   
00032   foreach $line (@lines) {
00033     $count++;
00034     $line =~ /runTime = (\d+\.\d+) sec/;
00035     $time = $1;
00036     if ($time < 0.1){
00037         $under0point1sec++;
00038     }
00039     elsif ($time < 0.2){
00040         $under0point2sec++;
00041     }
00042     elsif ($time < 0.5){
00043         $under0point5sec++;
00044     }
00045     elsif ($time < 1.0){
00046         $under1sec++;
00047     }
00048     elsif ($time < 2.0){
00049         $under2sec++;
00050     }   
00051     elsif ($time < 3.0){
00052         $under3sec++;
00053     }   
00054     elsif ($time < 4.0){
00055         $under4sec++;
00056     }   
00057     elsif ($time < 5.0){
00058         $under5sec++;
00059     }   
00060     elsif ($time < 10.0){
00061         $under10sec++;
00062     }       
00063     elsif ($time >= 10.0){
00064         $over10sec++;
00065     }   
00066     else {
00067       $nonvalid++;
00068     }  
00069   }
00070   my $percent_under0point1sec = 0;
00071   my $percent_under0point2sec = 0;
00072   my $percent_under0point5sec = 0;
00073   my $percent_under1sec = 0;
00074   my $percent_under2sec = 0;
00075   my $percent_under3sec = 0;
00076   my $percent_under4sec = 0;  
00077   my $percent_under5sec = 0;
00078   my $percent_under10sec = 0;
00079   my $percent_over10sec = 0;
00080   my $percent_nonvalid = 0;  
00081   
00082   $percent_under0point1sec = (int($under0point1sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;
00083   $percent_under0point2sec = (int($under0point2sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;
00084   $percent_under0point5sec = (int($under0point5sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;
00085   $percent_under1sec = (int($under1sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;
00086   $percent_under2sec = (int($under2sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;      
00087   $percent_under3sec = (int($under3sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;     
00088   $percent_under4sec = (int($under4sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;
00089   $percent_under5sec = (int($under5sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;
00090   $percent_under10sec = (int($under10sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;
00091   $percent_over10sec = (int($over10sec/$count*1000 +.5))/10;
00092   $percent_nonvalid = (int($nonvalid/$count*1000 +.5))/10;
00093 
00094   
00095   print "count = $count\n";
00096   print "under 0.1 seconds = $under0point1sec: ${percent_under0point1sec}%\n";      
00097   print "between 0.1 and 0.2 seconds = $under0point2sec: ${percent_under0point2sec}%\n"; 
00098   print "between 0.2 and 0.5 seconds = $under0point5sec: ${percent_under0point5sec}%\n";
00099   print "between 0.5 and 1.0 seconds = $under1sec: ${percent_under1sec}%\n"; 
00100   print "between 1.0 and 2.0 seconds = $under2sec: ${percent_under2sec}%\n";
00101   print "between 2.0 and 3.0 seconds = $under3sec: ${percent_under3sec}%\n";
00102   print "between 3.0 and 4.0 seconds = $under4sec: ${percent_under4sec}%\n";
00103   print "between 4.0 and 5.0 seconds = $under5sec: ${percent_under5sec}%\n";
00104   print "between 5.0 and 10.0 seconds = $under10sec: ${percent_under10sec}%\n";
00105   print "over 10.0 seconds = $over10sec: ${percent_over10sec}%\n";
00106   print "non valid response = $nonvalid: ${percent_nonvalid}%\n";
00107 
00108 exit(0);
